snippet: The Republican Party continues to try to disenfranchise voters. Just look at what one Georgia congressman tried to do this week.
abstract: Editorial condemns proposal by Paul Broun, a Republican congressman from Georgia, that no more money be spent on enforcing Section 5 of the Voting Rights Act of 1965; argues that his amendment, which would prevent the Justice Dept from supervising election-law changes in 16 states that have a history of discrimination against African-Americans, offers further proof that the Republican Party is trying to disenfranchise voters.
lead_paragraph: The Republican Party continues to try to disenfranchise voters. Just look at what one Georgia congressman tried to do this week.
